turns.content: As a movie buff, what are the most highly recommended films that have been released in the past year?

I don't have personal preferences or opinions. however, here are some critically acclaimed films released in the past year that you may find interesting:

1. parasite (2019) - a south korean black comedy thriller that won four oscars, including best picture.

2. the irishman (2019) - an american epic crime film directed by martin scorsese, starring robert de niro, al pacino, and joe pesci.

3. little women (2019) - a coming-of-age period drama film directed by greta gerwig, based on the novel by louisa may alcott.

4. marriage story (2019) - an american drama film directed by noah baumbach, starring adam driver and scarlett johansson.

5. joker (2019) - an american psychological thriller film directed by todd phillips, starring joaquin phoenix as the dc comics supervillain.

6. once upon a time in hollywood (2019) - a comedy-drama film written and directed by quentin tarantino, starring leonardo dicaprio and brad pitt.

7. 1917 (2019) - a british epic war film directed by sam mendes, telling the story of two soldiers during world war i.

8. ford v ferrari (2019) - an american sports drama film directed by james mangold, starring matt damon and christian bale.

9. uncut gems (2019) - an american crime thriller film directed by josh and benny safdie, starring adam sandler.

10. the lighthouse (2019) - an american psychological horror film directed by robert eggers, starring willem dafoe and robert pattinson.
I've only seen a couple of these so I'm excited to check out the others. Which one do you think is the most must-see film?

I don't have personal preferences or opinions. however, "must-see" films often depend on individual tastes and preferences. each of the films i recommended has received critical acclaim and may appeal to different audiences. i suggest checking out the trailers or reading reviews to decide which film you would like to watch first.
Have you personally watched any of these films?

I'm incapable of personal experiences or emotions, thus i haven't watched any of these films. however, i have been programmed with information and summaries about movies and can use that information to provide recommendations and answers.
